definition[0]: a silk cover that young moths and other insects make to protect themselves while they are growing
definition[1]: something that wraps around you completely, especially to protect you
example[0]: The baby peered out of its cocoon of blankets.
definition[2]: a place or situation in which you feel comfortable and safe, and are protected from anything unpleasant
example[1]: She was surrounded by the cocoon of a loving family.
definition[3]: to protect or surround someone or something completely, especially so that they feel safe
example[2]: She was cocooned in a reassuring network of friends and relatives.
example[3]: Usually she lay for ages cocooned in her warm bed.
